title: Dead keys (',",~,etc) not working for VNC connection to vSphere VM, unless held continuously
author: djpbessems
body_snippet:
## Expected Behavior
When typing, single keypresses on dead keys should produce actual characters after being followed by another key.

## Current Behavior
Context: a VNC connection to a VM running on vSphere, through vSphere's builtin VNC server.
Dead keys produce no output, unless held for roughly 5 seconds, then the output doesn't stop anymore.
For reference, the same VNC connection through Guacamole works as intended.

iterations.description: Dead keys (compose/accent keys) are not properly handled in VNC keyboard input—they need to be sent as key-down+key-up pairs without intermediate release, or via compose sequence logic, rather than treated as regular keys.

notes:
AI triage (claude): Dead keys (compose/accent keys) are not properly handled in VNC keyboard input—they need to be sent as key-down+key-up pairs without intermediate release, or via compose sequence logic, rather than treated as regular keys.
Approach: Intercept dead key WM_KEYDOWN events in the VNC protocol handler and defer sending until the composed character is resolved, or send the Unicode code point directly via RFB key event rather than relying on continuous key-hold timing.
